description.S1: Giles Molina, a scientist in Byzantium,
description.S2: asked you to rescue six sprats that escaped from his lab and fled into the tunnels beneath the city.

blurb.B1: Find Giles Molina near the maintenance tunnels in Byzantium.
blurb.B2: he will admit to losing his research sprats.
blurb.B3: They fled into the maintenance tunnels,
blurb.B4: and it’s too dangerous in there for him,
blurb.B5: with the rabid sewer sprats and automechanicals.
blurb.B6: He’s too attached to his sprats to turn down your help if you offer it.
blurb.B7: He even has names and backstories for them all

description.S1: Giles warned you that there are exterminator mechanicals prowling the tunnels.
description.S2: He'd prefer you return his sprats alive but said their corpses are still of scientific interest.

blurb.B1: Head down the elevator and rescue the 6 Sprats.
blurb.B2: You'll have to chase some of them,
blurb.B3: and press the interact button to capture them,
blurb.B4: As you explore, beware of Sprat Exterminator mechanics and an enormous Sprat called Kobalos that will attack you.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh! Um, what are you doing here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are YOU doing here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Just looking around.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Do I look like I wanna explain myself?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Excuse me.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Nothing. Nothing! Why, uh, does it- does it look like I'm up to something?

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Laws, I knew it. You got me. I'm caught, aren't I?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are you so worried about?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Look, whatever's going on, maybe I can help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yeah, you're in BIG TROUBLE. Now why don't you tell me what you did?

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: I work in the lab at the Ministry of Accuracy and Morale. Some of my sprats went missing, but it's not my fault, okay?

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Maybe I let them out more often than regulations allow, but they need to stretch their little legs!

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: ...And so what if I occasionally forgot to latch their cage? Everyone gets a little distracted now and then.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Calm down and tell me what happened.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You are really not helping your case.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: They escaped! And before I could coax them back, they'd made their way to the maintenance tunnels!

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Even if I did dare go down there, they're among all the common sewer sprats and exterminator mechanicals!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I could look for your sprats.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Good luck with that.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Really? In that case, take this collection crate. Six of my little ones are down there, but don't worry - you can easily tell them apart from common sewer sprats.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: They have intelligent eyes, an agreeable yet reserved demeanor, and a fondness for hiding. Also, they're white rather than green.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please, do take care, and do mind the exterminator mechanicals. If the worst should happen to my little darlings... well, I still want their bodies. For science, of course.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Something else?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are the maintenance tunnels beneath Byzantium for?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why are there exterminator mechanicals in the tunnels?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You seemed surprised I'd help you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Farewell.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, to maintain... things, of course. Like big, humming, machine things. With gears.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: And pipes. Water pipes. ...Air pipes. All sorts of pipes. That's why they connect the city, from the Acropolis District to here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: But why won't you go into the tunnels yourself?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Good to know.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Everyone knows sewer sprats carry diseases! And the exterminator mechanicals have been known to fire on... larger targets.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Why they'd do that when they're only supposed to attack sprats, I've no idea. But there are rumors.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Rumors? Like what?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm not interested in speculation.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Some people say there are strange things in those tunnels. Assassins. A room full of murderous automechanicals.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Monsters hungry for human flesh. A hidden bureaucratic purgatory where things - and people - are lost forever.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not that I place any stock in silly rumors, of course.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Your mind must rest easy, indeed.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: To deal with the sewer sprats, of course. They're quite the nuisance.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: I still am. After all, I'm a person of very little influence and only middling prospects. No one does favors for free.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: But I must say, I'm far too distressed to think critically about your suspiciously kind offer.

dialog.speaker: Giles Molina (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, there's nothing to see here! Nope. Nothing at all.
